Comments SAIDO BERAHINO claims he failed a drugs test because his drink was spiked in a nightclub. 
The Stoke striker, 23, missed a number of games for West Brom earlier this season with what was said to be fitness problems and depression . Getty Images 4 Saido Berahino has revealed he failed a drugs test and was spiked when he was at West Brom 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But Berahino has now said he failed a drugs test due to circumstances beyond his control. 
He said: “To be banned for something you haven’t done is hard to take. 
“You go on a night out, you don’t know who you are around and there are people out to get you. 
“I was in a nightclub, so I hold my hand up for being irresponsible. Getty Images News of Saido Berahinos drugs ban was leaked just 24 hours before he faced former club West Brom 
“From then on it all crashed down. 
“To this day, I still cannot understand who would want to do that to me.” 
West Brom boss Tony Pulis repeatedly deflected questions about his forward’s absence. Reuters 4 Saido Berahino was accused of lying by former boss Tony Pulis

But the England Under-21 international was in no mood to give any credit to his former club, with whom his relationship became strained. 
Berahino, who joined Albion at the age of 11, turned down three new contract offers and grew increasingly bitter after being denied a number of transfer-window moves to bigger clubs. PA:Press Association Mark Hughes and Saido Berahino have joined forces at Stoke despite the forward failing a drugs test 
He told BBC’s Football Focus: “No one protected me at that club. 
“I was depressed. Every morning I walked in the training ground and didn’t want to be there. 
“Going from loving something to hating the place that has made you is hard to take. Saido Berahino swaps goalposts for basketball hoops in Instagram video 
“Hate is a strong word but I really didn’t want to be there. 
“That is one of the reasons I didn’t sign the contracts they put on the table. It was not about money but happiness.”
